title: Allows attending physicians to admit persons arriving at the hospital for emergency treatment when such attending physician deems this necessary for care
summary: Allows attending physicians to admit persons arriving at the hospital for emergency treatment when such attending physician deems this necessary for care.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          754

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. RABBITT, FINCH -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Health

       AN ACT to amend the public health  law,  in  relation  to  admission  of
         patients in need of emergency medical care

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 2805-b of the  public  health  law  is  amended  by
    2  adding a new subdivision 4-a to read as follows:
    3    4-A.  NO  ATTENDING  PHYSICIAN  SHALL BE PREVENTED FROM ADMITTING TO A
    4  GENERAL HOSPITAL, AS A PATIENT, ANY PERSON ARRIVING AT THE HOSPITAL  FOR
    5  EMERGENCY  TREATMENT  IF SUCH ATTENDING PHYSICIAN DETERMINES THAT ADMIT-
    6  TANCE OF SUCH PERSON IS REQUIRED FOR CARE.
    7    S 2. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
    8  it shall have become a law.






        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01631-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the public health law, in relation to admission of patients in need of emergency medical care
